sentences.text: Hello My name is Linda and I am from Chicago, IL USA.
I‚Äôve been teaching English for 11 years and I have TESOL/TEFL diploma.
I also have a degree in Business Management I love teaching and I love to see my students excel.
Beside teaching, I love to read, I am passionate about cooking and I love to travel.
I have 11 years of teaching experience and I am TEFL/TESOL certified.
In our class we focus on your specific needs and I tailor-cut all my materials and activities based on your specific situation.
My students described my classes as well structured and productive Let's excel in English together!
With 11 years of experience, I'll tailor our classes to meet your needs.
Get ready for structured and productive sessions that will help you reach your goals.
Join me on this language journey and let's make learning English exciting!
Hi, my name is Rhian and I‚Äôm from Wales.
With 6 years of experience in education, I've had the pleasure of teaching a wide range of subjects, but my true passion lies in teaching English as a Second Language.
I am committed in helping students from diverse backgrounds master the English language.
My goal is to create an engaging and supportive environment where every student feels empowered to explore, learn, and communicate with confidence.
My teaching philosophy centres on the belief that education should be both challenging and enjoyable.
I‚Äôm dedicated to helping students discover their strengths, overcome language barriers, and develop the communication skills that will open doors for them worldwide.
Whether we're diving into the nuances of grammar, expanding vocabulary, or practicing real-life conversations, I strive to make every lesson meaningful and memorable.
Outside of the classroom, I have a variety of interests and hobbies that keep me inspired and balanced.
I'm an avid reader, always on the lookout for a good book, and I enjoy writing as a creative outlet.
I also love spending time outdoors, walking with my children and dog in the beautiful landscapes of Wales.
Cooking and trying out new recipes is another passion of mine, as it allows me to be creative while enjoying delicious food.
Book your English lessons with me where I will help you achieve your language learning goals!
My English language teaching journey has been fun and rewarding so far.
I am enjoying teaching a variety of ages over lots of different topics; however I am focusing on honing my skills in teaching children, conversational English and IELTS.

I bring over six years of experience teaching in a primary school setting, where I‚Äôve developed a deep understanding of how to create a supportive and effective learning environment for young learners.
My time in the classroom has honed my ability to tailor lessons to diverse learning styles, ensuring that each student is able to engage with the material in a way that suits them best.
I‚Äôve had the pleasure of working with pupils between the ages 3-11, helping them build strong foundational skills in core subjects while fostering a love for learning.
In addition to my primary school experience, I hold a TEFL certification, which has allowed me to expand my teaching expertise to include English language learners of all ages.
My TEFL certification is complemented by several specialised qualifications that enable me to English for young learners, academic English, and conversational English.
These additional qualifications have equipped me with the tools to address the specific needs of different student groups.
My teaching methodology is rooted in a student-centred approach.
I believe that effective learning occurs when students are actively engaged in the process, and I strive to create lessons that are interactive, practical, and relevant to their lives.
Whether I‚Äôm teaching grammar, vocabulary, or conversation skills, I emphasise real-world applications, helping students connect what they learn in the classroom to their everyday experiences.
I also prioritise creating a positive and inclusive classroom atmosphere, where students feel comfortable taking risks and making mistakes as part of the learning process.
I also believe that building good rapport with students is essential, ensuring familiarity and comfort which helps student‚Äôs confidence.
Academically, my background is grounded in both education and language studies, providing me with a strong foundation for teaching English at various levels.

I continuously seek to update my knowledge and skills through professional development opportunities, ensuring that my teaching practices are informed by the latest research and best practices in the field.
Subject expertise is another key aspect of my teaching practice.

My experience covers a broad spectrum of English language instruction, including: - Young Learners: Engaging and age-appropriate content designed to make learning English fun and effective for children.
- Academic English: Preparing students for academic success with a focus on writing, reading comprehension, and critical analysis skills.
- Conversational English: Engaging in discussions, debates, talks about a wide range of topics to help improve and finesse fluency and pronunciation.
Overall, my diverse teaching experience, combined with my specialised qualifications and dedication to continuous learning, allows me to offer a purposeful educational experience to my students.
I am committed to helping you achieve your language goals in a supportive and dynamic learning environment.
Discover the joy of learning English with me!
I believe in creating a supportive and engaging environment where you can explore, learn, and communicate with confidence.
Together, we'll overcome barriers, develop skills, and achieve your language goals.
Let's embark on this exciting journey of language learning!

"Learning a new language isn‚Äôt just about words; it‚Äôs about discovering new worlds and endless possibilities." üëâÔ∏èHelp with presentations and building public speaking confidence üëâÔ∏è Interview preparation.

üëâÔ∏èBasic English for daily life and travel purposes üëâÔ∏è Business English üëâÔ∏èFluency üëâÔ∏èLearning new vocabulary üëâÔ∏èPronunciation skills I‚Äôm a native English speaker, and I teach English in an engaging and enjoyable way.
My lessons cover phrasal verbs, idioms, tongue twisters, and discussions on topics like work or everyday life.
If you're starting or aiming to work at an international company, I can help you improve your English skills to achieve your dream job.
Hi there, my name is Mahwish.

Hello My name is Teacher Kat and I am from South Africa.
My passion is teaching children and I have two of my own beautiful children that I love to spend time with.
I enjoy music, dancing, cooking and being outdoors.

I would love to get to know you and your personal goals.
I like to tailor my classes to each individual students needs and interests.
I make use of my own materials and plenty of pictures to help keep children engaged and interested.
I look forward to meeting and helping you in your English journey.
Hello, my name is Julia and I am from South Africa.

The methods I commonly use when teaching is the Communicative Language Teaching method(CLT) and the Total Physical Response method ( TPR) as I find the most success and progress while the aid of these methods.
Come on and join me on a fun and engaging journey where we can work together to achieve your learning goals.

I am a creative.

I am a good listener and a great conversationalist.
‚ù§Ô∏è I have a BA in Performing arts with English literature as my second Major.
and completed a TEFL diploma at Cape Town TEFL institute and have since gained 7 years of experience in the field of TEFL.
I have taught English to Adult learners in Taiwan, Turkey, and Vietnam and I am currently teaching online Full time.
Methodology: In my language classes, I will create a context you can relate to.

I will typically elicit a response, instead of feeding you with the answer to ensure that you can have maximum speaking opportunity and I will always follow up with questions to make sure that you fully understand each point, before moving to the next point.
a Typical class structure: Introduction - our Language topic.
Warm-up Controlled exercise Listening/Reading Feedback, Q and A - Corrections - Pronunciation.
Grammar points with some controlled practice.
Dialogue.
Feedback and Corrections.
When you book your trial lesson with me, we will get to know each other and go over your study goals.
We will come up with a detailed plan on how we will best achieve these goals.
What type of lessons will best suit you and how many lessons you will need.
After our First Lesson, I will give you some homework to do in preparation for your next class so that you can prepare and gain maximum benefit out of your lesson time.
During your next lesson, we will go over and discuss your homework and make sure that you understand everything clearly before moving on to the next topic.

I will always give you either oral or written feedback after each class and I will keep note of the areas in which you may need to improve so we can adjust your lesson plans accordingly, as we go along.
I look forward to working with you in order to achieve your study goals.
üåü Don't let language barriers hold you back ‚Äì seize the opportunity to become a confident and proficient English speaker!

Certified and Licensed Tutor with TESOL from Arizona State University, USA, and an SLP degree.
I have an American accent and a British accent and 8+ years of experience teaching international students English in person and on Preply.
I can design lessons tailored to your specific needs, whether it be - PRONUNCIATION: -- Are native speakers finding it hard to understand you?

SPEAKING: --Are you translating from your mother tongue?

READING: Are you reading the same line many times?
Increase your reading speed and comprehension LISTENING: Can't understand American/British/Australian speakers?

I'll break down the sounds of these accents and help you understand the overall meaning too WRITING: I'll help you use Accurate Grammar and punctuation and write perfectly structured essays, emails, and narratives.
GRAMMAR: Grammar does not have to be boring!

With my Speech and Language Pathology background, I have studied linguistics, phonetics, anatomy, and physiology of speech and language and how infants develop language skills so I use proven methods to incorporate music, visuals, and games into making your journey fun and beneficial as knowing how to transfer knowledge to students in a fun and easy-to-understand way is important.

I have helped students from all around the world to speak English confidently and get their desired IELTS scores, aspiring university students land their dream jobs, and professionals get job promotions, and assimilate into English-speaking countries, the goal being to inspire and motivate students to gain confidence in expressing ideas fluently in English.
I understand that every student has a unique capacity and learning style, be it visual, auditory, or kinesthetic.
So I incorporate games, pictures, and standardized exercises from big names in ESL.

I have helped primary and elementary students learn English as a subject - Understand prose/ poetry/literary techniques and ace TOEFL jr, GCSE, and NAPLAN exams and other subjects like History, Science (Chemistry and Biology), and Geography.
1-1 lessons!!!
**Interview Prep We will practice answering typical interview questions in your specific field.

I will help you understand Academic and General English in an easy step-by-step method.
Having taken both the General and Academic IELTS multiple times myself with a score of 9, I have first-hand experience and can relate to your difficulties.
I have also motivated students to get their desired score on their first attempt How I can help you: ‚úî‚úîFor speaking, Struggling to monitor your mistakes while you speak???
With mock tests, I provide feedback on pronunciation and fluency and practice till you can communicate confidently on various topics.
We will practice idea generation, idea development, cohesion and coherence.
‚úî‚úîFor reading, I will help you read faster with full comprehension, skim, scan, and find answers quicker.

‚úî‚úîFor listening, I can help you train your ears to understand the American, British, and Australian accents and practice techniques to listen and answer simultaneously.
So what are you waiting for?
:) Come book your first lesson with me today!
-IELTS -Business English -Accent Reduction -ESP -Children's English -British English Mastery Hi there!

i am a patient and kind teacher.

My name is Mynette.

Hello!
My name is Brooke and I am from the United States.
I love to read and tell stories with a cup of coffee in my hands.
I enjoy hiking and running in my city, but I love spending time with my friends and family the most.
With years of experience with students from over 45 countries and with many English levels, I am familiar with common struggles of English students.
With a friendly approach to correction, students gain confidence with me to experiment with different grammar, phrasing, and vocabulary.
With clear explanation and practice with a variety of exercises, students make progress at their pace and learning what they need and want to know.
I focus on practical skills my students want to learn in English, such as applying for jobs, topic conversations with native English speakers, and more.
I have personally taken the CELPIP/IELTS test, and I am able to help you prepare for your exam!
It's not as scary as you think it is, especially when you have me cheering you on!
If you want to learn or practice your English, especially American and Canadian English, you have found the right person.
My English lessons are practical, varied, and based around what YOU want to learn.
Join me for interesting topics of conversation to improve vocabulary and fluency, such as friendship as an adult, current events, or discussing sustainable tourism.
Navigate grammar and what English speakers ACTUALLY say in normal conversation.
Learn the difference between sayings that can be misinterpreted in different settings.
I know that you don't want to take English classes forever, so come join me and make REAL progress!
**As a note: I do require at least 4 lessons for students looking for someone to help with speaking for a job interview skills or a test.
Please plan these dates in advance and have them prepared.
I will no longer take students for one lesson.
Thank you for your understanding.**
Hello everyone!
My name is Emily and I am currently traveling the world while teaching English online.
I love to share my passion for teaching with my students and it makes me excited to see every type of improvement.
I enjoy music, reading, dancing, and sports.
I have been working full time as an online English teacher since 2021 and have loved every moment of it!
I started by volunteering to teach English for 3 years and found that I loved it so much that I decided to continue it as my main job.
I don't use a set curriculum.
Instead, I have many different resources and I base every lesson off of what you as the student needs.
I am always open to feedback or any changes in the lesson because I want to make sure we meet your goals.
With me as your tutor, you will learn correct pronunciations from my neutral Canadian accent, which will help others understand you no matter where you go.
I also focus a great deal on conversation and correct uses of every day speech, but also more formal business language.
You will be able to have a conversation with anyone, whether it is a stranger at the grocery store or your boss at work.
Additionally, I am a health care professional, so if you need to learn medical terminology, I can help with that.
I have had many jobs working in a setting where I see many new English speakers.
This has helped me come up with new and innovative methods to aid in understanding as well.

Because I am a lover of languages, as I am currently working on learning Spanish, French and Arabic, I have tested and tried many styles of language learning on myself and have come up with ways to help make learning easier.
During the trial lesson, I like to become acquainted and discover what your learning style is and how I can best help you.
Everyone learns differently and has specific needs and interests, so in the trial lesson, these things are uncovered.
Following that, I complete a lesson and assign a small amount of homework to help you remember what was learned.
The trial lesson is quite fun because it is very interesting to get to know each other and see how you can improve in just one lesson!
Hello, my name is Ciara and I'm from Edinburgh in Scotland!
I love guiding students on their learning journey and look forward to helping you meet your goals!
I really enjoy talking about film, television, and literature, and aim not just to improve your ability to speak English, but also to ground our sessions with an understanding of Anglophone culture.
I have lots of previous experience of teaching students English online and am also an experienced tutor in film studies, having taught university classes both in-person and online.
I'm TEFL certified and have several years experience of teaching English online.
My work as a university film studies tutor has also added to my understanding of how best to support learners.

I am experienced at lesson planning and take a student-centred approach to teaching which emphasises moving at the student's pace and taking time to consolidate concepts which prove difficult to grasp.
I'm very patient and easy-going, and like to keep lessons informal so that students are relaxed.
I am keen to tailor sessions to the interests of the student, as it always easier to learn when you're engaging with something you care about!
I like to build our lessons around different types of media, allowing you to gain a broader experience of spoken and written English.
In the past I have used TED Talks, newspaper and magazine articles, YouTube videos, and scenes from film and television as resources.
If you book a trial lesson with me, we can discuss your goals and how I can help you meet these!

A trial lesson also gives us the chance to get to know each other a little - letting you decide whether you like my teaching style, and allowing me to learn about your interests so that I can make sure our lessons use material that you are enthusiastic about.
Hello!
My name is Holly, I am an experienced English Teacher and Psychology Tutor from the United Kingdom (Manchester).
I have experience working with students of many different ages and levels, and I like to adapt my lessons to your individual needs and preferences.
I can support you with specific exam preparation (IELTS); conversational skills; grammar; interview preparation etc., whatever your needs are.
Before teaching, I was a therapist in the NHS, meaning I am experienced in building compassionate and warm relationships with people to help them reach their goals.

I am currently living in Barcelona learning Spanish, so I know how scary and overwhelming it can be learning a new language, but I am here to help you feel confident and comfortable enough to practice and improve :-) I am a native speaker from the UK and I am Trinity Cert TESOL and TEFL certified which means I am professionally qualified to help people learn English as a foreign language.

I have helped people from ages 16-35 with various things such as IELTS preparation, University applications and interviews (including Oxbridge); work applications and interview preparation, general conversational practice, even preparation for the UK Driving Theory test!
If you have specific topics you want to cover, we can make sure to design our lessons around those.
In our first trial lesson we can discuss exactly what it is that you want support with, any worries you might have, and get to know each other a bit to see if we would be a good match.
Students and Business professionals - together we can improve your English!
I have helped many Business professionals with their job interviews with preparation questions and Interview practise.
I can really help Business professionals who want to improve their English for job needs (e.g.
tax and accounting vocabulary, small talk at work, negotiations and networking) and opportunities.
I am a business graduate from London, United Kingdom.
I am a qualified Chartered Accountant as well as a Certified TEFL teacher.
Contact me for details of the lessons and book a class to discuss the lessons you need!
I have helped people with writing CVs, job interviews, conversational English, presentations, and building confidence when speaking.

All lessons are tailored to your needs, including for specific industries and professions Fore example: medical and legal english, business english for HR, marketing and IT as well accounting and finance.
My teaching style is friendly and enthusiastic - I try to get to know the students and tailor the lessons to their needs often sending them useful information between lessons.
I have many years experience as a business professional working in London, UK.
I have also taught, mentored and coached over 1000 lessons to many adults who need to improve their English for work or their personal self-improvement.
I start by discussing your English goals and formulate an English Action Plan with you.
We then review every 5 lessons what we have covered and where we should proceed to ensure that your progress is right for you.
If you are looking for a job, I can help you with the process of writing your CV and cover letter, job interviews and help you through the process.
With help and determination, you can achieve the job of your dreams.

If you have a job and have to speak English in meetings, give talks or presentations, I can give you confidence by going through the language and phrases you use to sound interesting and professional.
Most importantly, you can practise your speeches with me and feel prepared for the event.
I am also helping many students to improve their English who have moved to the UK.
I will help with Life in the UK exam and cultural aspects.
Hello Students!
I'm Sarah, a nature-loving, adventurous tutor with a laid-back teaching style.
I can help you to become a confident speaker and grow your vocabulary with regular conversations about things that interest you.
We can work on your reading and debating skills with online articles and your listening skills with podcasts or videos.
If you need to learn Business English for work, this can be done.
We can read and discuss case studies for industry-specific language or work on your general office conversation skills with speaking lessons and role-play.

‚úîÔ∏è After class, I will summarize your performance, send feedback ‚úîÔ∏è Should I learn Mandarin or Cantonese?
Not gonna lie, Mandarin and Cantonese are both difficult for native English speaker.
But Mandarin is slightly easier because it has four lexical tones( compare to six in Cantonese ) and there are way more resources to support Mandarin learning than that for Cantonese.
‚úîÔ∏èHow should I prepare for the sessions?
I will send you a personalized syllabus once you have set up a consistent weekly schedule with me.
Then I will send you materials before each session.
There's no need for you to preview or study them before hand.
But I found my students usually learn better if the print out the materials and make notes on them during the session.
‚úîÔ∏èHow long does it take to acquire the language?
There really is no definite answer for this question.
It all depends on each student's aptitude and pace.
As long as you don't quit on me, I will be there with you every step of the way.
‚úîÔ∏èHow often do you conduct your sessions?
This depends on your availability and your budget.
The key for language learning is immersion, meaning the more exposure you have to the target language, the better and faster you learn.
That being said, most of my students meet with me once or twice a week.

Through translation work, I have gained a deep understanding of the language cultural differences between Chinese and English.
I often encountered challenges due to the various cultural and linguistic differences between Chinese and English.
Let me give you a few examples: Do you know what "‰∏≠‰∫åzh≈çng √®r " means?

However, there isn't a single term that can fully capture the essence of ‰∏≠‰∫å in English‚Äîthis is precisely the challenge brought about by cultural and linguistic differences.

‚ÄúWhat we learn is not just a language, but also an experience of a different culture.‚Äù ‚ùóPlease note that I exclusively focus on teaching ADULT Mandarin and do NOT teach children‚ùó „ÄêBeginner Level„Äë In this class, let's first understand how Mandarin is pronounced and how characters are written.
Gradually, you will be able to piece together some words.
We will be about to learn Pinyin or Zhuyin, tones, 32 strokes, as well as commonly used radicals.

„ÄêIntermediate Level„Äë For beginners, I'll not only guide you through understanding sentence structures and grammar but also show you the "multi-word chunks, conversational routines and fixed expression".

Such as Happy New Year "Êñ∞Âπ¥Âø´Ê®Ç" or I‚Äôm kidding with you "ÊàëË∑ü‰Ω†ÈñãÁé©Á¨ëÁöÑ" You wouldn't say New Year Happy "Âø´Ê®ÇÊñ∞Âπ¥" or I‚Äôm with you kidding "ÊàëÈñã‰Ω†Áé©Á¨ëÁöÑ" Learning these chunks is like building with blocks; the more you know, the more sentences you can form effortlessly.

„ÄêAdvanced Level„Äë Do you feel like your spoken Mandarin is not improving as much as you'd like?
Let's discuss news, current events, variety shows, movies, TV series, or even challenging stand-up comedy shows to help you enhance your ability to express yourself.
We won't be limited to textbooks, and I'll use interesting methods to assist you in improving your spoken Mandarin!
„ÄêListening-up„Äë Do you find it challenging to understand the native speaker during actual conversations because they speak too fast?
Can you understand the content of movies or TV shows without subtitles?
Don't worry, I have a course dedicated to training your listening skills.
By meticulously dissecting the authentic pronunciation of native speakers.

„ÄêHSK„Äë„ÄêTOCFL„Äë If you plan to work or apply to universities in Taiwan or China, you may need either an HSK or TOCFL language proficiency certificate.
HSK employs simplified Chinese characters, while TOCFL uses both simplified and traditional Chinese characters.
Both certifications cover comprehensive training in listening, speaking, reading, and writing.
With my assistance, I believe you can successfully obtain the certification and will be ready to embark on your journey to Taiwan or China!

Hi everyone, I‚Äôm Chen, the only Chinese tutor who was invited to speak at the 2024 Preply Tutor Conference, where I presented on my techniques on "Making the Chinese Classroom Fun!" As a tutor with many beginner students, I‚Äôve noticed that one of the biggest challenges is helping students remember Chinese characters without relying on pinyin.
After the HSK2 level, more characters start to appear, and it can feel overwhelming‚Äîsometimes even causing students to give up.
To make Chinese learning enjoyable and effective, I‚Äôve created a variety of memory strategies to make it easier to remember characters.
Here are some examples: ÂêÉ (to eat): The left part represents a mouth, the right top is a person, and below is a table‚Äîimagine a person sitting at a table using their mouth.
It‚Äôs easy to connect this to ‚Äúto eat.‚Äù Âñù (to drink): Again, there‚Äôs a mouth on the left.
On the right, the top half is a sun, and below is a person lying in bed.
Why is he still in bed when the sun is up?
Because he drank too much last night‚Äîhence, ‚Äúto drink.‚Äù Âæà (very): If you look carefully, you‚Äôll see an inverted r on the left, an inverted E on the right, and a v and y at the bottom.
It looks a bit like a scramble of the letters in ‚Äúvery‚Äù!
These are just a few examples of my memory strategies.
I use character components, letters, visuals, and even humor to make characters fun and memorable.
In fact, I have techniques like this for all 150 words in HSK1!
With my approach, you‚Äôll find every character interesting and easy to learn.
You won‚Äôt need to rely on pinyin or copy words repeatedly‚Äîthe hints I give you will be your key to mastering Chinese characters.
For Listening and Speaking: In HSK1 and HSK2, I prepare six questions for each lesson to encourage conversation.
By the end of these levels, you‚Äôll have practiced around 180 question-answer pairs, covering essential spoken Chinese!
Starting in HSK3, I set aside 15 minutes each class for conversation practice, where we‚Äôll discuss topics or images, helping you form accurate sentences and paragraphs.
And of course, we‚Äôll complete workbook listening exercises as well.
For Writing: For younger students, I include Chinese character writing practice in each class to help reinforce memory and understanding.
For adults, I focus on typing to build writing and grammar skills.
This includes sentence formation, answering questions, and sentence translation.
By HSK3, you‚Äôll be able to Speak fluently, type, and understand Chinese messages!
My approach combines entertainment with practicality, making learning both enjoyable and effective.
I also customize courses based on your needs, so each lesson is tailored just for you.
While my classes may be a bit more costly, they‚Äôre absolutely worth it!
My students have been thrilled with my memory strategies and conversation practice, which is why I was chosen to speak at this year‚Äôs Preply Tutor Conference.
If you‚Äôre interested in learning Chinese in a fun and engaging way, come join me!
I look forward to sharing the joy of Chinese learning with you.
I look forward to seeing you in my class, let us enjoy learning Chinese together.

So a few months later, I formally applied to become a part-time Chinese teacher for foreigners.
Teaching Chinese to foreigners is not just a job for me, but also an opportunity to make more friends from different countries and learn about their countries‚Äô cultures .
Because of the mindset that I have as a Chinese teacher, so my students and I always interact as friends, my classroom is always filled with laughter and joy.
The atmosphere in my classroom is very relaxed, which enables you to speak Chinese confidently without even realizing it!

Since I have approximately six years of experience teaching Chinese to foreign friends, I have developed my own unique and targeted teaching methods!
I have a great way of presenting information and very organized structure of my lesson and I also tailor my lessons based on my students level!
The following is a part of the structure of my lesson: For example: Grammar.
What is grammar?
In a word, grammar is a way of speaking in our daily lives.
So my grammar lessons won't give you explanations that even Chinese people might find hard to understand, like those explanations in textbooks.
Instead, I focus more on why Chinese people speak in a certain way.
There are significant differences between English and Chinese grammar, including word order,which is most Chinese learners would suffer from it.
So I have my own methods to help you better understand how Chinese people speak.

Here's an example:(It‚Äôs very important to know how to divide a sentence into different chunks) "We /both like /traveling and food/ at the same time." But in Chinese, we say it this way: "We /at the same time/ both like/ traveling and food." By comparing these two sentences, have you learned how to say it in Chinese?
I have categorized and summarized the differences in the way Chinese and English speakers express themselves.
In other words, if your English foundation is not too weak, I can guarantee that you will quickly learn how Chinese people speak.
Through practicing conversations with me in the classroom, your speaking skills will improve rapidly.
This is the combination of theory and practical application, which is innovative and effective.
Once we have mastered how Chinese people speak, do we only need to learn Chinese characters?
Yes, that's right.
I know Chinese characters seem like drawing to you, haha.
So we can't rely on rote memorization.
I will explain some difficult characters by combining them with historical stories and imagination.
That way, as long as you encounter these characters more frequently, you won't forget them.
I will help you with this during the reading training section of my class.
For students preparing for the HSK exam, I will also provide practice questions in class.
By discovering and addressing problems through these exercises, I will give you targeted assignments after class.

Regarding pronunciation issues, for students who already have a foundation in pronunciation, I will correct your pronunciation during conversations and encourage you to actively use words with specific sounds.
This will help your tongue and mouth muscles get accustomed to producing those sounds.
Poor pronunciation is mainly due to not hearing enough correct pronunciations and our tongues and mouth muscles not being accustomed to producing them.
Also, I assign homework after every class and explain it before the next class starts.
So please don't complain that it's too tiring!
If you are interested in how I teach Chinese, don't hesitate to book a trial lesson with me so I will be able to know your Chinese level better and make a personal study plan for you!

I am a native English speaker with a passion for teaching.I grew up on the exotic island of Gozo, learning British English at home and Maltese at school.
Malta is a country which relies heavily on tourism, so many of my friends came from a variety of different backgrounds.
This was probably where my curiosity about other countries started.
After my school years as a student, I specialised in teaching English, a popular profession in Malta due to the large numbers of tourists.
I spent 7 years teaching at a language school in Malta, where most of my students were enjoying a learning holiday.

These students came from Brazil, Germany, France, Spain, Poland, Tunisia, Libya, Serbia, Russia, China, South Korea and Japan, though I ended up meeting students from pretty much every corner of the world.
After this period of teaching and continuous professional development in Malta, I felt confident enough in my skills and qualifications to try working abroad.
My first work-holiday took me to Vietnam where I ended up spending a whole year travelling the country and teaching while on the go!

I enjoyed this trip so much that I then decided to continue my travels, and turn what had started as a holiday into a more permanent situation, teaching online while travelling to and learning about different countries and cultures.

Over the years I have taught ages from 7 to 70 and everything in between, had classes of up to 20 students at once as well as one-on-one intensive lessons, and lead exam preparation courses with set syllabuses alongside compiling my own material for General English classes.
I also have some limited experience teaching Business English, though it is not exactly my strong point.
I now teach online while travelling around Europe in my camper van, following the warm weather and living life as it comes at me.

Hello, I'm Alex!
I'm half English half Greek, and I grew up bilingual in the UK just outside London.
I now speak 4 languages fluently and another 2 at a proficient level.
I understand the difficulties in learning new languages, but I also know the best ways to learn them!
My accent is similar to what you hear on the BBC or perhaps that of James Bond.
I enjoy travelling, football, cooking and watching Kevin Smith as well as Martin Scorsese films.
I worked for Inlingua, teaching English in companies for just over half a year in Italy.
I have also taught to people in Greece on a one-to-one basis.
My methodology is very simple, and it is the reason why I speak 4 languages fluently (soon to be 6!) - I take the same approach as when I was a child.
I call it the Natural Method.
Think about how you learned your mother tongue.
You didn't ask questions about grammar or wonder why the syntax changes if you use a specific verb.
You just listened and repeated.
We aren't going to change the rules of language.
We just need to know when to use them and accept them.
It worked for me.
It worked for my former students in Italy and Greece.
I will work for you too!
Learning a new language can be challenging, but I‚Äôll guide you through it as I did for myself and many others.
Together, we'll embrace the natural learning method, making the process enjoyable and effective.
